articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…
articleContent:
Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel reduce its workforce by at least 14% by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel confirms a reduction of at least 14% of its total workforce by August 31, 2024. The reduction must be officially announced or reported in Intel's financial statements or press releases. If the reduction is less than 14% or not confirmed by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…

Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will a major tech company announce layoffs affecting over 10,000 employees by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if any publicly traded technology company with a market capitalization of over $50 billion announces layoffs affecting more than 10,000 employees by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…

Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel's stock price increase by more than 20% from its October 1, 2023 closing price by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel's stock price on any trading day before or on August 31, 2024, closes at a price that is more than 20% higher than its closing price on October 1, 2023. The stock prices will be based on the primary listing exchange for Intel's shares. If the stock price does not reach this threshold by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around

fqTitle: Will a major semiconductor company announce a significant expansion in AI chip production by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if any of the top 5 semiconductor companies by market capitalization as of October 1, 2023, announces a significant expansion in AI chip production by August 31, 2024. A 'significant expansion' is defined as an increase in production capacity of at least 30% or an investment of over $1 billion specifically for AI chip production. The announcement must be made through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre
articleDescription: Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month ahead of his 100th birthday with a musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre. The Carter Center said Thursday that the Sept. 17 event will be called “Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song” and will featur…
articleContent:
ATLANTA (AP) Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month, ahead of his 100th birthday, with a musical gala at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta, The Carter Center announced Thursday. 
The Sept… [+1834 chars]
fqTitle: Will a musical gala honoring a former U.S. president's 100th birthday take place at a historic theater in Atlanta by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a musical gala honoring a former U.S. president's 100th birthday occurs at a historic theater in Atlanta by August 31, 2024. The event must be publicly reported by at least two major news outlets. If the event is canceled, postponed beyond the resolution date, or does not take place as described, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre
articleDescription: Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month ahead of his 100th birthday with a musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre. The Carter Center said Thursday that the Sept. 17 event will be called “Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song” and will featur…

The Sept… [+1834 chars]
fqTitle: Will a centennial celebration for a living former U.S. president be held at a prominent entertainment venue by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a centennial celebration for a living former U.S. president is held at a prominent entertainment venue by August 31, 2024. The event must be widely reported in mainstream media. If no such celebration occurs, or if it's held at a different type of venue, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre

fqTitle: Will a major cultural institution in Atlanta host a birthday tribute for a notable political figure aged 99 or older by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a major cultural institution in Atlanta hosts a birthday tribute for a notable political figure aged 99 or older by August 31, 2024. The event must be confirmed by official sources and reported by reputable news organizations. If no such event takes place, or if it occurs outside of Atlanta, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
articleDescription: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
articleContent:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will India's loan offer to Vietnam for maritime security exceed $300 million by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if India increases its loan offer to Vietnam for maritime security purposes to an amount greater than $300 million by August 31, 2024. The increase must be officially announced by the Indian government or reported by at least two reputable international news sources. If no increase is announced or the loan amount remains at or below $300 million, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
articleDescription: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
articleContent:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will trade between India and Vietnam double by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the total trade volume between India and Vietnam increases by 100% or more compared to the October 2023 levels, as reported by official government statistics or reputable economic institutions by August 31, 2024. If the trade volume does not double or if no reliable data is available to confirm the doubling, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner

NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will a South Asian country announce a loan exceeding $500 million for maritime security to a Southeast Asian nation by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if any South Asian country (India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bhutan, or Maldives) officially announces a loan of more than $500 million specifically for maritime security purposes to any Southeast Asian nation by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be made by the lending country's government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources. If no such announcement is made or the loan amount does not exceed $500 million, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Marketing firm fined $40,000 for 2022 GOP mailers in New Hampshire
articleDescription: New Hampshire authorities say a Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 state primary violated the law. The attorney general's office said Thursday that forms su…
articleContent: CONCORD, N.H. (AP) A Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 New Hampshire state primary violated the… [+1158 chars]
fqTitle: Will a political marketing company be fined over $50,000 for campaign-related violations in the United States by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if a political marketing company operating in the United States is fined more than $50,000 for violations related to campaign materials or activities by August 31, 2024. The fine must be imposed by a state or federal authority and publicly reported by at least two reputable news sources. The violation must be directly related to campaign activities, such as the design or distribution of campaign materials. If no such fine is reported or if the highest reported fine is $50,000 or less, the question will resolve as NO.

articleTitle: Marketing firm fined $40,000 for 2022 GOP mailers in New Hampshire
articleDescription: New Hampshire authorities say a Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 state primary violated the law. The attorney general's office said Thursday that forms su…
articleContent: CONCORD, N.H. (AP) A Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 New Hampshire state primary violated the… [+1158 chars]
fqTitle: Will a state attorney general's office announce legal action against a marketing firm for election-related violations by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a state attorney general's office in the United States publicly announces legal action against a marketing firm for violations related to election materials or activities. The announcement must be made through official channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. Legal action includes filing lawsuits, issuing cease and desist orders, or imposing fines. If no such announcement is made, or if the announcements are made by entities other than a state attorney general's office, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Marketing firm fined $40,000 for 2022 GOP mailers in New Hampshire
articleDescription: New Hampshire authorities say a Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 state primary violated the law. The attorney general's office said Thursday that forms su…
articleContent: CONCORD, N.H. (AP) A Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 New Hampshire state primary violated the… [+1158 chars]
fqTitle: Will a marketing company agree to pay a fine exceeding $30,000 for violating state election laws by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a marketing company agrees to pay a fine greater than $30,000 for violating state election laws in any U.S. state. The agreement must be publicly reported by at least two reputable news sources and confirmed by the relevant state authority. The violation must be directly related to election laws, such as improper design or distribution of election-related materials. If no such agreement is reported, or if the highest reported fine agreement is $30,000 or less, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger
articleDescription: An inmate has been sentenced to more than four years in connection with the 2018 prison slaying of notorious Boston gangster James “Whitey” Bulger. Paul J. DeCologero was sentenced Thursday. He was accused of being a lookout while another inmate…
articleContent: CLARKSBURG, W.Va. (AP) An inmate was sentenced to more than four years Thursday for his role in the 2018 fatal bludgeoning of notorious Boston gangster James Whitey Bulger in a troubled West Virginia… [+4205 chars]
fqTitle: Will an appeal be filed against the sentencing of an inmate involved in a high-profile prison killing by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if an appeal is filed against the sentencing of an inmate involved in a high-profile prison killing that occurred in 2018. The appeal must be formally submitted to a higher court and acknowledged by the court system. The question resolves as NO if no such appeal is filed or officially recorded by August 31, 2024.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger
articleDescription: An inmate has been sentenced to more than four years in connection with the 2018 prison slaying of notorious Boston gangster James “Whitey” Bulger. Paul J. DeCologero was sentenced Thursday. He was accused of being a lookout while another inmate…
articleContent: CLARKSBURG, W.Va. (AP) An inmate was sentenced to more than four years Thursday for his role in the 2018 fatal bludgeoning of notorious Boston gangster James Whitey Bulger in a troubled West Virginia… [+4205 chars]
fqTitle: Will additional inmates be charged in connection with a 2018 prison killing by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if one or more additional inmates are formally charged by prosecutors in connection with a prison killing that took place in 2018. The charges must be officially filed and recorded in the court system. The question resolves as NO if no new charges are filed against any inmates related to this case by August 31, 2024.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger

articleContent: CLARKSBURG, W.Va. (AP) An inmate was sentenced to more than four years Thursday for his role in the 2018 fatal bludgeoning of notorious Boston gangster James Whitey Bulger in a troubled West Virginia… [+4205 chars]
fqTitle: Will a documentary about a notorious gangster's prison death be announced by a major streaming service by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a major streaming service (such as Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, or Disney+) officially announces the production or release of a documentary focusing on the prison death of a notorious gangster. The announcement must be made through official channels or reported by at least two reputable news sources. The question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made by August 31, 2024.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will a major US-Russia prisoner exchange occur by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States and Russia conduct a prisoner exchange involving at least three individuals from each country. The exchange must be officially confirmed by government representatives from both nations or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question will resolve as NO if no such exchange occurs within the specified timeframe or if the exchange involves fewer than three individuals from either side.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will an American journalist be released from detention in Russia by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, an American journalist who was detained in Russia is released and allowed to return to the United States. The release must be officially confirmed by the U.S. government or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question will resolve as NO if no such release occurs within the specified timeframe or if the released individual is not a journalist.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will a US corporate executive detained abroad be freed by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a United States citizen who holds or held an executive position in a corporation and was detained in a foreign country is released and allowed to return to the United States. The release must be officially confirmed by the U.S. government or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question will resolve as NO if no such release occurs within the specified timeframe or if the released individual does not meet the criteria of being a corporate executive.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.
Jobl… [+2061 chars]
fqTitle: Will weekly U.S. jobless claims exceed 300,000 by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Department of Labor reports that initial jobless claims for any single week exceed 300,000 by August 31, 2024. The figure must be reported in the official weekly release and not be subsequently revised below 300,000. If no such report is made, or if the highest reported weekly figure remains below 300,000, the question will resolve as NO.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.
Jobl… [+2061 chars]
fqTitle: Will the U.S. unemployment rate rise above 4.5% by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports a monthly unemployment rate exceeding 4.5% for any month up to and including August 2024. The rate must be reported in the official monthly jobs report and not be subsequently revised below 4.5%. If no such report is made, or if the highest reported monthly unemployment rate remains at or below 4.5%, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year

articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.

fqTitle: Will a major U.S. company announce layoffs affecting over 10,000 employees by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a publicly traded U.S. company listed on the S&P 500 index announces layoffs affecting more than 10,000 employees in a single announcement by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If no such announcement is made, or if the largest announced layoff affects 10,000 or fewer employees, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
articleContent:
The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will a rule banning airlines from charging extra for children to sit with parents be implemented by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a rule is officially implemented that prohibits airlines from charging additional fees for children aged 13 or younger to be seated next to their parents or guardians on flights. The rule must apply to both U.S. and foreign carriers operating in the United States. The question resolves as NO if such a rule is not implemented by the specified date.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
articleContent:
The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will a major U.S. airline voluntarily adopt a policy to seat children with parents at no extra charge by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one of the top 5 U.S. airlines by passenger volume voluntarily implements a policy to seat children aged 13 or younger next to their parents or guardians without charging additional fees. The policy must be publicly announced and implemented. The question resolves as NO if no such voluntary policy is adopted by any major U.S. airline by the specified date.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…

The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will there be significant public opposition to a proposed airline seating rule for families by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is substantial public opposition to a proposed rule regarding airline seating for families. Significant opposition would be indicated by at least 10,000 public comments against the proposal submitted to the Department of Transportation, or by a major airline industry group publicly opposing the rule. The question resolves as NO if there is no such significant opposition by the specified date.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed
articleDescription: Security forces have fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the country’s spiraling economy. At least two people were reported killed in northern Niger stat…
articleContent: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) Security forces fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria on Thursday as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the count… [+3186 chars]
fqTitle: Will Nigeria experience nationwide protests involving over 10,000 participants by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if credible news sources report nationwide protests in Nigeria involving more than 10,000 participants in total across multiple cities by August 31, 2024. The protests must be related to economic issues or government policies. For resolution, at least two reputable international news organizations must report on the scale of the protests.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed
articleDescription: Security forces have fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the country’s spiraling economy. At least two people were reported killed in northern Niger stat…
articleContent: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) Security forces fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria on Thursday as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the count… [+3186 chars]
fqTitle: Will a state of emergency be declared in Nigeria due to civil unrest by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the Nigerian government officially declares a state of emergency in response to civil unrest or protests in any part of the country by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets and confirmed by an official government statement.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed
articleDescription: Security forces have fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the country’s spiraling economy. At least two people were reported killed in northern Niger stat…
articleContent: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) Security forces fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria on Thursday as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the count… [+3186 chars]
fqTitle: Will the reported death toll from protests in Nigeria exceed 10 by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the cumulative reported death toll from protests in Nigeria exceeds 10 people by August 31, 2024. The deaths must be directly linked to protest-related activities or security force interventions. At least two reputable international news organizations must report on the death toll for resolution.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed
articleDescription: Security forces have fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the country’s spiraling economy. At least two people were reported killed in northern Niger stat…
articleContent: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) Security forces fired gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests across Nigeria on Thursday as thousands, mostly young people, poured onto the streets to rally against the count… [+3186 chars]
fqTitle: Will an international human rights organization conduct an investigation into protest-related deaths in Nigeria by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a recognized international human rights organization (such as Amnesty International or Human Rights Watch) announces or completes an investigation into protest-related deaths in Nigeria by August 31, 2024. The investigation must be publicly announced and focus specifically on deaths occurring during protests or as a result of security force actions against protesters.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will NHTSA issue new regulations for automated driving systems by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) issues new regulations specifically addressing automated driving systems in vehicles by August 31, 2024. The regulations must be officially announced and published by NHTSA. This does not include proposed rules or draft regulations that have not been formally adopted.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will a major automaker suspend its automated driving system program by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if any automaker among the top 10 global manufacturers by sales volume announces a suspension or discontinuation of their automated driving system program by August 31, 2024. The suspension must be company-wide and affect all vehicles with such systems. Temporary pauses for updates or limited recalls do not count as a suspension.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will U.S. road fatalities involving vehicles with automated driving systems exceed 10 by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if official reports from U.S. government agencies or reputable news sources confirm more than 10 fatalities involving vehicles operating with automated driving systems in the United States by August 31, 2024. The fatalities must be directly linked to the operation of the automated driving system at the time of the incident.
